page.title: 18Science
page.content: Pliocene marine formation at St.Erth. In places the moulding-sand is capped with clay, and in l88l, when the clay was being worked as a puddling-clay, marine fossils were discovered in it. Since then many collectors have visited the deposits, a number of papers have been published,and a general consensus has emerged that the clay is Pliocene in age. The clay in turn is capped with a layer of solifluction-earth or head. The first scientific paper to describe the clay as 'a tough boulder clay, with marine shells' was in l882 and it has been investigated several times the most recent being l973 by G.F.Mitchell on behalf of the Royal Society.
